et: New Latin {it}onus{/it} ({it}probandi{/it}), literally, burden of proving

dt.t: put forth a theory that left the {wi}onus{/wi} squarely on him

quotes.t: These laws got the regulatory ball rolling, but the {qword}onus{/qword} was on the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to ensure that additives were safe.

Consumers should be able to limit the use of information beyond what's essential to complete a transaction. There are two principal ways to do this: Web sites can permit them to "opt in," or explicitly grant advance permission to share information. Or they can put the {qword}onus{/qword} on consumers to "opt out" if they don't want information shared.
It is not the scions of Yale and Harvard who apply to become FBI agents and construction workers and civil servants and cops who bear the {qword}onus{/qword} of this reverse discrimination.

dt: {bc}burden of proof {bc}the duty of proving a disputed assertion or charge

shortdef: burden of proof : the duty of proving a disputed assertion or charge

dt: {bc}one of the often indefinite or unequal subdivisions into which something is or is regarded as divided and which together constitute the whole

dt.t: … the road was passable only {wi}part{/wi} of the year …
Change is an inevitable {wi}part{/wi} of life.

dt: {bc}one of several or many equal units of which something is composed or into which it is divisible {bc}an amount equal to another amount

dt.t: mix one {wi}part{/wi} of the powder with three {wi}parts{/wi} of water

dt: {bc}one of the constituent elements of a plant or animal body: such as

dt.t: The stomach is {wi}part{/wi} of the digestive system.
a novel in four {wi}parts{/wi}

dt: {bc}a vocal or instrumental line or melody in concerted music or in harmony
{bc}a {a_link|particular} voice or instrument in concerted music

dt.t: the violin {wi}part{/wi}

dt: {bc}a constituent member of a machine or other apparatus

dt.t: the {wi}parts{/wi} of an airplane
automobile {wi}parts{/wi}

dt: {bc}something falling to one in a division or apportionment {bc}{sx|share||}

dt.t: wanted no {wi}part{/wi} of the proposal

dt: {bc}one's share or allotted task (as in an action) {bc}{sx|duty||}

dt.t: one must do one's {wi}part{/wi}

dt: {bc}one of the opposing sides in a conflict or dispute

dt.t: he that is not against us is on our {wi}part{/wi}
you're not from around these {wi}parts{/wi}
took off for {wi}parts{/wi} unknown

dt: {bc}a function or course of action performed

dt.t: objected to the government's {wi}part{/wi} in the strike

dt: {bc}an actor's lines in a play, movie, etc.

dt.t: The actress learned her {wi}part{/wi} well.

dt: {bc}the role of a character in a play, movie, etc.

dt.t: played the {wi}part{/wi} of the villain
a man of many {wi}parts{/wi}
His {wi}part{/wi} was on the left side of his head.

dt: {bc}as far as one's share or interest is concerned

dt.t: {it}for my part{/it}, I do not see that the difference is important
{it}for the most part{/it} the crowd was orderly

pt: {sc}part{/sc} {sc}portion{/sc} {sc}piece{/sc} {sc}member{/sc} {sc}division{/sc} {sc}section{/sc} {sc}segment{/sc} {sc}fragment{/sc} mean something less than the whole. {sc}part{/sc} is a general term appropriate when indefiniteness is required.

pt.t: they ran only {it}part{/it} of the way

pt: {sc}portion{/sc} implies an assigned or allotted part.
{sc}piece{/sc} applies to a separate or detached part of a whole.
{sc}member{/sc} suggests one of the functional units composing a body.
{sc}division{/sc} applies to a large or diversified part.
{sc}section{/sc} applies to a relatively small or uniform part.
{sc}segment{/sc} applies to a part separated or marked out by or as if by natural lines of cleavage.
{sc}fragment{/sc} applies to a part produced by or as if by breaking off.

pt.t: only a {it}fragment{/it} of the play still exists

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French & Old English, both from Latin {it}part-, pars{/it}; perhaps akin to Latin {it}parare{/it} to prepare {ma}{mat|pare|}{/ma}
shortdef: one of the often indefinite or unequal subdivisions into which something is or is regarded as divided and which together constitute the whole
an essential portion or integral element
one of several or many equal units of which something is composed or into which it is divisible : an amount equal to another amount

stems: came down on us like a ton of bricks
hit him like a ton of bricks

dt.t: The loss of his job {phrase}hit him like a ton of bricks{/phrase}.
Our boss {phrase}came down on us like a ton of bricks{/phrase}.
